intro: Mazaea shaferi, commonly known as the Shafer's mazaca, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Native to specific regions in Central Asia, it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant's botanical features include hairy stems and capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
